name: Crowne Plaza Manila Galleria

reviews.text: Well.. if this hotel was as stated in the other review here.. kudos to management and staff for making a tremendous improvement. We were scheduled for the Holiday Inn but it was overbooked so we were overflowed to the Crowne Plaza. It was definitely good fortune for us as the CP is a higher quality hotel. We were walked from one hotel to the next and escorted through the entire process. Each day.. it didn't matter who we passed in the hallway at any time.. I was ALWAYS greeted by the staff and wishe a good day, or evening, or "morning sir." It seemed authentic and I haven't experienced this in a while (certianly not in the last year of my travels in USA and SEASia). The staff was always attentive and helpful. I had ants invade my mini-bar area and made a call to housekeeping. Less than 5 minutes later someone was there to deal with it. There were some issues with my deposit (I had only brought a debit card) and they were kind and understanding that I needed to get some cash from an ATM and waiting patiently (over 24 hours) for me to do so. The internet service was a bit spotty and would not work on my hotmail account but I had not problem walking over to the mall and using their free (yes free) mall wide wireless service. Just sat in Starbucks or outside Gloria Jeans to do what I needed to do. The breakfast buffet (with room) was complete and the staff made me any manner of ommelette or fresh juice concotion I asked for. The hotel was hosting some tabloid magazine in their ballroom for an awards complete with hi-so and entertainment types, cameras, t.v. coverage, etc. I would have expected to be kept away and made to use an alternate route to the mall.. but alas, was not. The staff actually noticed I did not "belong" to this even and helped me make my way thorugh to the mall and back. Bravo. One thing.. the Concierge was nice, warm, and attentive (and cute) but he didn't know much about Manila. They had not map of the transportation system or a city map. When asked about an event (basketball) he asked the other workers who "thought" it was happening. They should be more informed about basics like city transportation.
reviews.title: REally a good experience....service was notable!
OK with great potential
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location adjacent to a mall. The mall is actually accessible in the hotel. The rooms are nice and complete with all the amenities that you may need. Being a new hotel, there are still quite a few things that they can improve upon. Service is the number one thing that needs improvement. If you're just looking for a nice, clean, and a good location hotel, then you'll be happy with the Crowne Plaza Manila. However, if you're looking for a nice hotel with great service, then you may be disappointed with this hotel. It's not that they provide bad service, it's just that there is still room for improvement, especially if they want to compete with the Shangrilas, the Mandarin, or the Peninsula. Overall, we had a nice stay in this hotel and will definitely stay here again.
we had someone did the footwork on finding a clean hotel in quezon city to be nearby the relatives.
reviews.title: need lots of improvements

reviews.text: I'm a seasoned traveler and stay in hotels over 100 nights a year. Previously my hotel of choice in Manila was the Westin. As the Westin pulled it's franchise from the run down Philippine Plaza, i've stayed at the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza, Ortigas. Hotel is outstanding! Rooms are new and lovely; staff is very helpful and competent and the location is ideal as it's connected to a huge shopping mall. Although i give the hotel, staff and service 100%; my only complaint is the cable television which is lacking several necessary channels. Thanks to the staff and them management. You've done a great job.
reviews.title: A Delight in the City

reviews.text: This hotel is superb in every way. It was my first stay and the good impression started at the airport. The immaculately-turned out driver who turned up in a well-maintained hotel car to pick me up offered refreshments and called on to let the reception know I was on my way. The result was that on arrival I was welcomed by name by the door and reception staff and was in my room very quickly indeed. The room itself was superbly furnished – see photographs - and the toiletries provided in the bathroom were of high quality. Food at the restaurant was equally impressive. I stayed for four nights and have nothing but praise for the helpful, polite and efficient staff. The Galleria shopping centre, to which access is possible from the third floor, is well worth a visit also.
reviews.title: A really excellent hotel - highly recommended!

reviews.text: Note however that Manila is BIG and that Quezon City is one part only – if your business in is other areas the distances involved from this hotel may make for slow travel, especially in rush hours. Before booking into this, or any Manila hotel, you need to check out exactly where you will be spending most time, and then choose your hotel accordingly.
reviews.title: Good value for your money

reviews.text: Some day all hotels will aspire to this standard. European – and particularly Dutch and British Hotel Managements, which so often seem to behave as if the guests were an inconvenience – please note!
reviews.title: absolutely awful!
Must Visit Again!
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the hotels' executive suites which has a huge bathroom -- separate shower, deep soak tub and sink. There is a lockable sliding door that separates this area from the toilet and another sink which can be accessed from the living area. The bedroom has a tv, king sized bed and more than the usual number of pillows, plus a chaise lounge. The living area has a large work desk, minbar, sofa and easy chair. The decor wasn't my style (I don't like odd shaped sofas) but still tasteful. Service was speedy -- we requested for extra robes which got to us in less than 5 minutes. This was my first time in the hotel -- I didn't dine in any of the outlets, didn't spend much time exploring, so I can't give much info about ambiance and other facets. Nevertheless, in terms of location (attached to a shopping mall with offices, and numerous dining, shopping options within minutes) the Crown Plaza is a good choice if you need to stay in this area. I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Stayed here for 3 weeks on business - can't fault any aspect. Staff were amazingly friendly, helpful and courteous. Room was wonderful (platinum member so upgraded). Facilities in the nearby mall were all that you could want for. I used the hotel transport every day and it was efficient, on time and extremely good value for money.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

likes.liked: — Everything, especially the friendly people and the personal recognition

reviews.text: The food and welcome in the business lounge was invaluable, and really made the stay something special.
reviews.title: Best Value Club Floor

reviews.text: If returning to Manila, I would not stay anywhere else other than here! Highly recommended
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel.

reviews.text: I am by no means a vetean hotel traveller, but I do like good service and modern decor. I got both in spades at this hotel! We stayed on the Club floor, and it was excellent value when compared with similar hotels in the UK and Australia. The staff were exceptionally helpful and the club lounge a truly relaxing environment. We did not need to eat dinner in the evenings, as the hot hors d'ouvres were freshly cooked, regularly topped up, and accompanied by some excellent red wine. The room was fairly standard, but it was the red carpet treatment and the lounge facilites that really made this hotel stand out. An added bonus was the attached Galeria shopping mall, which meant we could pop out shoe shopping, without the hassle of arranging a car and driver! I will never stay anywhere else in Manila.
reviews.title: Comfortable -- grab corner rooms when booking standard/deluxe!

likes.liked: — Access to a mall & comfy beds
likes.disliked: — Some of the front desk people take themselves too seriously

reviews.text: To start off, booking at the crowne plaza was a breeze. I called the US number first from here and booked using my priority club (great rewards program, btw) and i paid using a credit card. Then I called again when I got there, and they had my room ready and waiting, and they add a nice touch by writing my name on the welcome card.
reviews.title: Good place for business

likes.liked: — Great comfy bed and excellent in-room facilities

reviews.title: OK
reviews.text: Stayed just for one night. Robinson's Galleria one of Manila's well known malls is accessible to the hotel. A convenience store

open 24 hours is just on the opposite side of the street. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Room was likewise nice and large. But despite keeping the thermostat in the lowest possible setting for several hours, air con was not cool enough. The hotel is relatively new so most of the facilities are clean. But it is more of a business type hotel with no feeling of elegance and grandeur. Consider it if you have business in the Ortigas or Quezon city area, though nearby Edsa Shangrila is better (im not ssure of the price comparison though). However, Its far from the tourist areas of Manila (Intramuros). But for you to be able to enjoy the Philippines, you have to go outside manila and see the beaches of boracay, cebu or bohol.
reviews.title: Personality-free Conference Hotel

likes.liked: — Friendliness of staff; quality of food
likes.disliked: — Somewhat overpriced, bland, and in non-exciting part of town

reviews.text: Stayed here six days on business. I'm a Priority Club member, so that helped get me on the 18th of 19 floors, and included admission to the club lounge, which is the best move you can make: free Internet, free happy hour, breakfast, snacks, hot hors d'oeuvres that can make a dinner.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Incompetent Management

reviews.text: * This is a perfectly fine hotel for business and conferences, but not vacation/resort feeling. For that, get out of Manila, or go stay on the bay in the new Sofitel. Quezon City is also not particularly interesting.
reviews.title: Hard Lesson Learned

description: Crowne Plaza Manila Galleria soars into the sky above the bustling city streets. Step into the opulent, light-wood Lobby and staff will take care of your luggage. You can head straight to your stylish room, with high-speed Internet, or check emails with wireless Internet in the Lobby's Agenda cafe. You can ask the Crowne Meetings Director to tailor our 15 meeting rooms, all with wireless Internet, to your needs. Host receptions for 1,500 people in our sumptuous Grand Ballroom or invite colleagues to a boardroom. A staffed Business Centre is at hand.
